sub_title: Montessori & IB Educator | Teacher Coach and Trainer | Content Creator | Integrated Science Specialist
summary:
I am a highly motivated and dedicated educator with leadership skills who excels at implementing best teaching practices and creating child friendly pedagogical material. 

My educational background is in biology, with a master's specialized in science education. I have twelve years' of experience teaching elementary and secondary school students. After starting my teaching career in Spain, I spent five years working in the U.S.A. where I got my Montessori elementary certification; moreover, I was awarded E.S.L. Teacher of the Year 2018. In 2019, I moved to the Netherlands, where I am currently based.

To me, teaching life values is as important as the curriculum itself. Working in an international school allows me to bring my love and experience of different cultures and languages and make a difference to the students.

treasury_media.title: 31st DWM Montessori School, Nima
treasury_media.description:
I feel very grateful for having had this great opportunity to exchange knowledge with such an amazing group of educators.
While facilitating the Montessori training, I felt the passion all attendees shared for making a positive impact on their students. I also witnessed outstanding educational practices. 
Thank you Ms. Antoinette for making it possible and thank you 31st DWM Montessori School for hosting me!
#Montessoriforall #MontessoriGhana

profile_positions.description:
- Create and develop English Montessori materials for guides to teach and students to work on writing, grammar, reading comprehension and function of words.
- Model, co-teach, co-plan and offer opportunities for teachers to learn how to deliver the English lessons. 
- Organize and lead the English reading club, held in weekly basis. 
- Co-write the school’s English policies.
profile_positions.title: Upper Elementary English Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
- Collaborate with the school leaders and teachers to evaluate campus data to identify and implement high-impact instructional strategies.
- Observe, evaluate and provide feedback, and training to teachers. 
- Model, co-teach, co-plan and offer opportunities for teachers to rehearse identified effective practices.
- Create a portfolio of some of the actions taken.
profile_positions.title: Effective Practice Specialist

profile_positions.description:
- Provide inter-disciplinary lessons in a multi-age group, self contained ESL classroom (1st through 3rd grades).
- Create a close-knit, loving classroom environment.
- Growing children's academic and interpersonal abilities and differentiating for their unique learning styles.
- Create engaging and differentiated lesson plans.
- Classroom management.
- Communicate with families and tutors.
- Organise after-school workshops for children and their families to become familiar with the Montessori philosophy and its pedagogical materials.
profile_positions.title: Lower Elementary Multigrade Montessori Teacher & Mentor

profile_positions.description:
- Lead weekly Science professional learning communities of five first grade Math/Science teachers. 
- Organize Science labs and Science field trips.
profile_positions.title: Science Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
- Teach Math, Science, and ESL to about 40 bilingual/ELL students.
- Instill a growth mindset to 40 students in a culturally responsive educational setting.
- Cooperatively create and plan engaging and exploratory lessons and curriculum with grade level Math and Science team.
- Communicate with students' families or tutors.
- Organize multiple events for my students, families and community to get to know my culture. Ex: PenPals, concerts, fairs, workshops, etc.
profile_positions.title: First Grade Bilingual Teacher & Mentor

profile_positions.description:
- Teach Math, Science and ESL to about 120 students ( ages 12 to 16 years old)
- Coordinate the subjects Oral English and Health and nutrition.
- Home room teacher of 30 students through the school year. 
- Develope students' learning goals according to their needs.  
- Collect, track and use students' data to drive individualized instruction. 
- Design effective lesson plans, units and assessments.  
- Facilitate organized, student-centered, objective-driven lessons. 
- Check for student understanding and responds for misunderstanding. 
- Differentiate instruction for student needs by employing a variety of instructional strategies.
- Communicate content and concepts to students. 
- Set and implement discipline management procedures.
- Communicate with students families throughout the school year.
profile_positions.title: Secondary School Science, Maths & English teacher, and  Integrated Science Electives Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
- Guide and oversee the pastoral team ensuring everything is arranged, organized and advertised to the staff and the students. 
- Student care and safety were at the forefront my job, as well as being there to direct and support 12 Residential Co-ordinators and the Assistant Residential Co-ordinators as their line manager. 
- Organise an lead regular staff meetings ensuring all staff is informed about the current events and that paperwork is completed on time e.g. rotas, registers, risk assessments and reports. 
- Ensure routines such as food deliveries, laundry and cleaning are arranged and completed regularly. As part of my duty of care I work closely with on site medical staff to ensure student health care was at its highest. Responsible for student welfare.
-Attend senior management meetings, be a link between departments. 
- Lead the pastoral team staff appraisal process and help to mentor staff.
- On arrival and departure days, arrange the meet and greet of new students on the campus and create a staff duty rota for Sunday transfer days.
profile_positions.title: Pastoral manager (Summer School)

profile_positions.description:
Actions taken to increase the population environmental awareness:
- Design of an environmental campaign to promote recycling in town.
- Create an environmental divulgation blog (Link below)
- Organize informative meetings with the shops and corporations in town.
- Organize informative meetings and workshops for the population (children and adults).
- Organize and coordinate Fair Trade events.
- Create informative resources and visuals related to recycling.

Actions taken to increase the quantity of waste recycling.
- Write an environmental project: "How To Reduce Waste in Vila-rodona"
- Coordinate and do a follow up study of the collection of all waste fractions.
profile_positions.title: Environmental Technician and Environmental Educator

profile_positions.description:
- Plan lessons, present information, promote discussion, assess performance and modify learning techniques in the study of Biology.
- Instruct students in large classroom settings as well as small groups to expand knowledge of scientific method and biological sciences.
- Conduct laboratory sessions for experiential learning in addition to classroom research and study.
- Guide and assess last year students in their Personal Project.
- Foster a positive learning environment. 
- Encourage active participation and monitor individual student performance to enhance their understanding and master skills
- Attend departmental and school-wide educator meetings on monthly basis in addition to quarterly training conferences for continuing education.
- Communicate with students and parents through conferences, telephone calls and email about student performance, goal setting, behavior problems and other issues
- Conduct safety drills or lead guidance sessions when necessary throughout school year for overall student security outside of biology instruction.
profile_positions.title: Primary School Science Teacher & Secondary School Biology Teacher

profile_positions.description:

- Visit schools, senior citizens, and community groups to educate others.
- Give presentations and facilite workshops.
profile_positions.title: Environmental Educator

company.name: Ilaz Montessori School, Daar Es Salaam

volunteer_experiences.role: Ponente del V Congreso Internacional Montessori
volunteer_experiences.description: El Congreso Internacional Montessori, organizado por Tu Guía Montessori ofrece de forma gratuita y digital ponencias de manos de expertos y expertas sobre la crianza, desarrollo infantil, educación y otros temas pertenecientes a la pedagogía Montessori.

The Childhood Potential Online Montessori Conference gathers Montessori experts from around the world for three days of information-packed sessions exploring Montessori babies, toddlers, and young children, is completely free of charge and accessible virtually from anywhere in the world.

• Conference Presenter - The VI Childhood Potential Online Montessori Conference

AMS is a not-for-profit organization based in New York City and is an advocate for quality Montessori education.

• Conference Presenter - The Montessori Event 2023 in Boston

company.name: COCAT (Coordinadora de camps de treball a Catalunya)

volunteer_experiences.description:
I spent a month volunteering in an elementary public school in Goa, India.

My job consisted on visiting the schools and rural settlement of the region to present the importance of health and hygiene and the need for education among the adults along with the children. Volunteers needed to be very creative in designing the exclusive orientation for the people of the region. Volunteers who participate in these camps needed to bring materials, ideas from the program on their arrival after which the whole group settled on a plan of action decided by the team.

I worked in Goa, where most of the inhabitants are migrants and whose children do not have access to basic education. By collaborating with local NGOs FSL I aimed to provide basic education to these children.

- Responsible for instruction of planned lessons and activities for assigned aged children.
- Responsible for overall safety and well-being of assigned groups (e.g. being aware of any medical problems or special needs of the children).
- Deliver programming and actively participates in activities.
- Set-up and clean-up of program activities and/or arts and crafts.
- Maintain proper check-in and checkout procedures and assists in enforcing rules of the program.
- Prepare classroom, teaching materials and art supplies prior to student’s arrival.
- Organize field trips.
